Anyway, I didn't intend this to be a tweetstorm, but I disagree with this assertion that the "smart devs" are working on ETH or AUGER or something else. I just don't see it.

The people that wanted to make *Bitcoin* better and not trying to sell tokens of one type or another have stayed. What I've noticed is that the good devs are the ones trying to make Bitcoin better. The bad ones generally try to sell more or less useless stuff.

There has always been people that have been coding to make Bitcoin better. There have always been people trying to "get rich" by creating their own token starting way back with altcoins in 2011. The latter group moved to ETH because it was a better platform for them.
